resources.string: - The Happy Tree app is a mobile application designed to assist mango tree farmers in monitoring diseases on their mango trees.
What is the Happy Tree App?
What kind of information about mango tree diseases can I find in the Happy Tree app?
- The Happy Tree app provides valuable information about mango tree diseases, helping users understand and address common issues affecting mango trees.
Mango Pests, Diseases, and Control Methods - A Full Guide
Insights on the Mango Anthracnose and its Management
Mango Farming in Philippines: How to Start, Varieties, Planting, Care, and Harvesting

Antracnose is a fungal disease that affects a wide range of plants, including mango trees. It is caused by several species of fungi in the Colletotrichum genus, which can infect the leaves, stems, flowers, and fruit of the tree. Symptoms of antracnose on mango trees include small, dark-colored spots on the leaves, stems, and fruit.
Dark Brown, Black mostly seen in Warm and Dry period and grows on honeydew excreted by piercing sucking insects.

Red rust is a fungal disease that damages mango plants. Puccinia mangiferae affects the tree\'s leaves. Reddish-brown or orange pustules on the leaves may cause distortion and premature leaf drop. This reduces tree growth and fruit yield.

Powdery mildew is a fungal disease that affects mango trees. It appears as a white or grayish powdery growth on leaves, shoots, flowers, and fruits. Severe infections can weaken the tree and reduce productivity.
HUMIDITY: Moderate to high humidity, favorable conditions include warm weather
